str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
